segments.text: There's something surreal about this scene, like a painting gone wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so intent on polishing that plate, she seems a world away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But look at the chaos behind her! The sink is flooding, and she hasn’t a clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she’s standing in a puddle, completely indifferent.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel an unexpected anger rising up inside me, directed at her negligence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Children shouldn’t be left to their own devices like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that rickety stool, and it’s only a matter of time before he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout, to warn her, but the moment feels too fragile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen, usually a place of warmth and comfort, feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel sorry for the children; they just want cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
